channel.title: Stop NPC spawning?

item.title: Stop NPC spawning?
item.dc:creator: @Itachi_Uchiha Itachi Uchiha
item.description:
@Itachi_Uchiha wrote:

It doesn’t have to do with LoadNPCLists() because I have already tried it numerous ways with this tidbit with the same result.

For some reason ints throw nullpointers O.o…

randomBoolean is set to true in it’s own class, I never bothered in the demo code lines to add in the import :\

Read full topic

item.title: Stop NPC spawning?
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

Umm I know this may sound a little stupid but try using integer instead of boolean, just a suggestion, also , have you tested this on other sources?

I think because LoadNPCLists() is being called as soon as the server starts up, it could be a problem because the randomboolean hasnt been set to true or false?

Read full topic

item.title: Stop NPC spawning?
item.dc:creator: @Itachi_Uchiha Itachi Uchiha
item.description:
@Itachi_Uchiha wrote:

I have a minigame designed to cover the entire world, but the NPC sort of get in the way…
I need to find a way to make NPCs not generate under certain conditions(true value) upon server start up.

I have tried this:

public LoadNPCLists() { if(!randomBoolean) { loadNPCs(); } loadNPCList(); }

That seems to work but for some reason it messes up player movement, when they walk they run when they run they are … the black guy in the olympics.
Does anyone have an idea without messing up basic player functions?

Read full topic
